page.title: 03LOCAL HISTORY:PLACE NAMES
page.content:
The oldest{place names}go back to Iron Age (Celtic Times)the Thames derived from the celtic Tamesis.The Anglo Saxons crossed rivers at fords hence Wallingford.The ing meaning people of and wealis meaning a stranger.Other Anglo Saxon names include North Stoke meant a cleared forest area and daughter settlement and the Newnham of Newnham Murren.Ham meant homestead and the Murren came from the Norman Richard Morrin. Descriptive place names of the area are Crowmarsh,Winterbrook,Cart Gap,
Mead Furlong,Drunken Bottom(low and waterlogged),Bradford (broad ford), Byxfield(box tree field).
